Posts.Content: Hi I'm in too I joined the April group, then the May group.  Finally I start my treatment tomorrow - so here I am in the June group. Had surgery back at beg April.  Am TNBC - am going to have Docetaxel and Carboplatin.  Took my 1st steroids this morning. Louise
Posts.Title: **JUNE BREAST CANCER CHEMOTHERAPY CHAT**

Posts.Content: Thanks for replying Linda It was good to hear that despite your tiredness you can still get on with things.  I hope it continues like that for you going forward. I'm hoping to be able to carry on exercising a bit, but who knows, I'll just have to wait and see. Louise
Posts.Title: ***April 2019 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat***

Posts.Content: Hi Ronstar Thanks for the reply.  Hopefully I will soon find out what drugs I will be given.  Like you say, I can then research them.  Hopefully I will also pick up info on here about them. Thanks,  Louise
Posts.Title: ***April 2019 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat***

Posts.Content: Hi I'm new to the group.  My second time of having breast cancer - 1st time was 15 years ago, big shock that it came back.  Had op 2 weeks ago, cancer was all in the axillia/armpit and has spread to lymph nodes.   Now waiting for chemo treatment plan.  Not sure when it will start. I've just read all your posts and am a bit worried/scared. Last time I had chemo - 15 years ago - I had it every 3 weeks on a Thursday evening.  Was sick for 4 days, but then back at work on the Tuesdays.  So I coped with not much time off work, just a Fri and a Mon every 3rd week.  Reading all your posts - you all seem so tired, so often.   I was not expecting this, so am now unsure how I will feel.   Also, am confused by all the different drugs you mention.  15 years ago I wasnt told what I was given.  So much has changed. I thought I could handle this,  now I'm not so sure.
Posts.Title: ***April 2019 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat***

Posts.Content: Anyone else have experience of this please.  My breast cancer has returned after 15 years.  This time in axillia (high in the armpit)  Apparently it is wrapped round veins and vessels and consultant is not sure they can remove it all.  Anyone been through this or similar?  Thanks
Posts.Title: Breast cancer - axillia

Posts.Content: Really sorry to hear that surgery is not an option for you. Consultamt said normally they would attempt radiotherapy after operating.  But  not in my case because I have had radio in that area before  and you cant have it again in same place.  At the moment they are just telling me to wait and see what happens when they do op, to see how much they manage to remove, and then they will decide what to do.
Posts.Title: Breast cancer - axillia
